[h1] A better looking sorta-remake of Counter-Strike [/h1] 

[b] Why am I told to buy this for Garry's Mod maps? [/b] 
A lot of Garry's Mod maps require this game to be installed and mounted because of this game's tidy surfaces and environments, as opposed to Half-Life 2's [b] (GMOD's default game)[/b] run down maps.

[b] Spec requirements [/b] 
Easy to run. If you somehow can't run it, play the original game released in '99.

[b] Difficulty [/b]
I haven't played much of the Counter-Strike games, but I do know that Counter-Strike involves more strategy than your average shooter. Something to note is that hitboxes are bigger then the actual model, as opposed to CS:GO where they're smaller.

[b] So, overall? [/b]
I dunno. I don't play much Counter-Strike, so if you don't want this one.. than.. just download CS:GO for free?

CS:S has retained a small community that is far less toxic than CS:GO's and with the competitive aspect being thrown out of the window the game is just fun. It is much more basic than CS:GO but the core counter strike dna it's showing it's strong points,roots and age. I originally bought source out of curiosity since I was an active CS:GO player and I wanted to experience the previous game of this franchise. The strange thing is that after I quit CS:GO I found my self keep coming back to source despite the fact that CS:GO had left me with a sour taste in mouth. Now about those that have not played any cs game before, source is not the right place to start since it's a barebones multiplayer game in comparison to what CS:GO has to offer. Moreover, although its cheap it is not free. Furthermore the community is tiny and lacks compared to CS:GO's size and some of its gameplay aspects can be clunky. All in all I will call it a milestone in the multiplayer fps's history and a nice vacation for those tired of CS:GO.
It's the way better than CS:GO,believe me.

Very nostalgic feelings while playing this game.
